overview_summary: Neighboring landowners include a private development LLC, a small single-property LLC, a family trust, and the local municipality. The LLCs appear to be minor land investors (with little public information on ownership), while the family trust represents a longstanding individual landholding (see RESIDENT profile). Huachuca City (pop. ~1,600) owns nearby land and may eye new projects for tax revenue, though its official stance is not publicly stated ([www.biggestuscities.com](https://www.biggestuscities.com/city/huachuca-city-arizona#:~:text=,population%20of%20Huachuca%20City)).

neighbors.name: Jrl Development Llc
neighbors.claims: JRL Development LLC is listed as owner of two parcels near Huachuca City, but it has no identifiable local business operations or filings in Arizona (likely formed out-of-state) ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/PublicBusinessSearch/PublicBusinessInfo?entityNumber=23570747#:~:text=Arizona%20Corporation%20Commission%20Entity%20Information,Standing%20Approval%20Date%3A%208%2F17%2F2023%20Status)). No officers or members are publicly disclosed in county or state records (beneficial owner unknown). The entity’s name suggests a land development or investment purpose, and it has not been linked to any active projects or public statements in Cochise County (no media or permit activity found as of 2025) ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/recovery/locale/arizona/cochise#:~:text=Cochise%20County%2C%20Ariz.%20,include%20assistance%20for%20elementary%20and)) ([www.cochise.az.gov](https://www.cochise.az.gov/811/2025-Tax-Deed-Land-Sale#:~:text=Beginning%20Monday%2C%20November%203%2C%202025,and%20ending%20Friday%2C%20November)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns only 2 parcels; no known local ties or political activity; low public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Attempt to identify and contact the LLC’s principal; gauge interest in selling or partnering on development, as they may be primarily profit-motivated absent local attachments

neighbors.name: 381 W Railroad Dr Llc
neighbors.claims: 381 W Railroad Dr LLC is a single-purpose entity holding a 4.21-acre residential property (1-bed/1-bath house built 2011) at 381 W Railroad Drive ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/381-W-Railroad-Dr-Huachuca-City-AZ-85616/109585217_zpid/#:~:text=Skip%20main%20navigation%20Back%20to,%C2%AE%7D%20%24192%2Fsqft%20%241%2C062)). The property has been offered for rent (advertised at $650/month), indicating the owner’s investment intent as a landlord rather than an owner-occupant ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/381-W-Railroad-Dr-Huachuca-City-AZ-85616/109585217_zpid/#:~:text=,new%20build)). There are no Arizona corporation records revealing the LLC’s managers, suggesting a private individual investor as the beneficial owner (identity not public). The LLC has no known involvement in local civic matters or development projects, aside from owning this rental property.
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns a single residence; not a major employer or landholder; little public or political presence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the property owner diplomatically (via the LLC contact) to address any concerns about project impacts on their rental; emphasize measures to maintain property value and neighborhood quiet
Likely a longtime local landowner; approach via personal outreach respecting family’s ties to the land (See RESIDENT profile for details)

neighbors.name: Huachuca City City Of
neighbors.claims: The Town of Huachuca City (incorporated municipality) owns this parcel, indicating a public or community use for the land (e.g., utilities, right-of-way, or municipal facility). Huachuca City is a small town with about 1,600 residents and a modest tax base ([www.biggestuscities.com](https://www.biggestuscities.com/city/huachuca-city-arizona#:~:text=,population%20of%20Huachuca%20City)), which means town officials typically welcome economic development that can broaden the revenue stream. However, as a public body, the city’s stance on any specific project will depend on official deliberations and community input (no formal position has been announced; see project report). The municipality’s involvement as a landowner signifies that any development will need to address local zoning, infrastructure, and public interest considerations in collaboration with city authorities.
neighbors.influence_justification: Municipal authority over zoning/permitting; represents community interests; limited budget but holds regulatory power

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Huachuca City’s council and town manager through formal meetings; demonstrate benefits (taxes, jobs) and address municipal concerns (zoning, services) to gain official support
